Cheers [[User:Buckshot06|Buckshot06]] [[User_talk:Buckshot06|(talk)]] 07:35, 29 May 2012 (UTC) == History - Insurgency == This section is so badly written: "Since the uprising began, the Armed Forces are sent to crash the protestors. As the uprising progressed growing number of soldiers began to defect from the Syrian Armed Forces and formed the rebels army called Free Syrian Army.[9] On March 2012 the Syrian government issued new travel restrictions for military-aged males. Under the new restrictions, reported by local Syrian news outlets, all males between 18 and 42 were banned from traveling outside the country.[10] In late June, in an interview given by the rebels chief to Ashark Al-Awsat, Riad al-Asaad said that in recent time about 20-30 Syrian officers defect to Turkey each day.[11]" Can someone fix the English and link it to other articles that concern the Syrian insurrection? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/82.12.161.116|82.12.161.116]] ([[User talk:82.12.161.116|talk]]) 14:45, 1 July 2012 (UTC) == Leadership section corrected to show Sunni majority in rank and file military == 74% of the Syrian population are Sunni. The cited references, 17 and 18, do not support this conclusion. In fact, State.gov said the opposite: "Military leadership is heavily dominated by Alawi officers, but the vast majority of troops in uniform are Sunni." One sentence was changed to indicate the Sunni majority in the military.
